text: Hi <@U0327E1SP35>, while we don't want you using all of the boilerplate CSS, you _are_ allowed to create a copy of the layout.css file from it

What Brooke said. Maybe we should reword that a bit to be clearer. The idea here is that you shouldn't _start_ from the boilerplate, but copy/pasting from the boilerplate is fine. It's unfortunately a little grey in terms of making requirements, but the intention is to make folks show that they understand what all the bits are doing. If you start with the boilerplate, you can thrash around and meet the requirements without totally understanding what you're doing. If you start from scratch and copy/paste, you're demonstrating that you understand what you're doing. Sorry if that's not totally clear in the instructions.
ok, I appreciate it. But isn’t the layout.css file compiled from all of those “_*” css files?
I’ll take another stab at it and come back if i have more questions.

Hi, I'm also working on the Developer Practicum, I understand that we aren't allowed to use the boilerplate in it's entirety but we can pull from it, per the above thread. I just wanted to make sure it's ok to use the create-cms-project command to get started.
Thanks Jon. Got the CSS figured out (I think).
Good luck on the practicum, you’ve got this!
